moves.7... O-O 8. Qd2: Black has saved a move by not playing d6.  So he can react in the center now.
moves.8... d5 9. exd5 Nxd5 10. Nxd5 Qxd5 11. N: Black now has the only center pawn and a threat on b2.
moves.12. O-O-O: White is still pursuing the Yugoslav attack but the center is open and black can rake the queenside.
moves.12... Be6 13. Kb1: White protects the pawn and gets the king out of the shadow of black queen.
moves.13... Rac8: Fixing the white queen to guarding the pawn on c2 and starting to build an attack.
moves.14. Bd3: Finishing his development and protecting c2.
moves.14... Rfd8: Pinning the bishop and countering white's control of the d-file
moves.15. Bh6: The bishop on g7 is dangerous so white wants to trade it and weaken black's king.  White may still be thinking about prying open the h-file too.  But this allows black to pull the queen to a square that limits its ability to defend the king.
